event: Earliest human settlement in present-day Sweden after Ice Age retreat
Neolithic farming communities establish permanent settlements
Nordic Bronze Age culture flourishes with long-distance trade
Iron Age societies form regional chiefdoms
Viking Age begins, linking Sweden to Baltic and eastern trade routes
Christianity spreads, reshaping kingship and society
Archbishopric of Uppsala establishes Sweden’s church structure
Kalmar Union unites Sweden with Denmark and Norway
Gustav Vasa leads Sweden out of the Kalmar Union
Swedish Reformation establishes Lutheran state church
Sweden emerges as a centralized military state
Sweden intervenes decisively in the Thirty Years’ War
Sweden becomes a major Baltic power after the Peace of Westphalia
Great Northern War begins against rival powers
Defeat ends Sweden’s era as a great power
Loss of Finland reshapes Swedish borders and identity
Union with Norway is established under Swedish crown
Union with Norway is peacefully dissolved
Parliamentary democracy becomes firmly established
Sweden maintains neutrality during World War II
Sweden joins the European Union
